alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 27 at 5:49AM CDT until March 28 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 1 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Wet, slushy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of mainly 1 to 2 inches. Winds will be overall light, only around 10 MPH, and primarily out of the east to northeast. * WHERE...Dawson, Furnas, Phelps, Gosper, Harlan, and Phillips counties. * WHEN...From 10 AM Monday to 1 AM CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS..Snow is expected to mainly accumulate during evening hours when surface temperatures are coldest. During the afternoon hours, snow may generally struggle to accumulate.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
